Hello, I'm Daichi Matsumoto. While studying at Keio University, I have been working as a Software Engineer and Android Developer, engaging in development at various companies as well as personal projects. Over the past three years, I have primarily focused on Android app development using Java and Kotlin, while also exploring a wide range of technologies. 

I am particularly interested in UI/UX design, emphasizing usability and aesthetics to create intuitive and comfortable applications. Additionally, I enjoy keeping up with new technologies and optimizing systems to ensure efficient and scalable development. 

By leveraging my position as a student while gaining hands-on experience in the industry, I actively take on new challenges and strive to create meaningful and valuable products through technology.
Experience the thrill and excitement of music with Kanade! Kanade is an Android music player with synchronized lyrics display, Full Compose and compliant with Material3 design.
Enjoy a comfortable FANBOX life with FANBOX Viewer! Unofficial Android & iOS client application for pixivFANBOX with Compose Multiplatform.
The site you're looking at right now, a blog and portfolio site created with Compose Multiplatform for Wasm.
A command-line tool that leverages the OpenAI API to automatically translate Android string resource files (strings.xml).
I enrolled in the Department of Electrical and Electronic Engineering at Keio University's Faculty of Science and Technology and am currently still studying there.
Cookpad Inc.（クックパッド株式会社）

I had the opportunity to participate in a summer internship in 2022, which led to a long-term, employment-based internship. I have been with the company for about three years, from 2022 to the present. My primary work involved developing the Android client app for Cookpad.

I participated in the summer internships in 2023 and 2024. Through these experiences, I had the opportunity to continue, and I plan to start a long-term, employment-based internship in 2025. My primary work involved developing the Android client app for LINE, specifically in the chat division.
I participated in an internship in 2024, where I learned about application development modeled after real-world development processes.
